description: From Middle English norischen, from Old French nouriss-, stem of one of the conjugated forms of norrir, from Latin nutriō (“to suckle, feed, foster, nourish, cherish, preserve, support”).

verbs.description: nourish (third-person singular simple present nourishes, present participle nourishing, simple past and past participle nourished)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To feed and cause to grow; to supply with food or other matter which increases weight and promotes health.
examples: other carnivorous Animals are difficultly nourished by Plants alone

entries.meaning: (transitive) To support; to maintain; to be responsible for.
(transitive) To encourage; to foster; to stimulate
examples: to nourish a sense of self-worth

entries.meaning: (transitive, of a person) To educate or bring up; to nurture; to promote emotional, spiritual or other non-physical growth.
(intransitive) To promote growth; to furnish nutriment.
examples: This type of nourishes very well.
